OrderIdsProperties.description: A generic object for capturing all purchase order ids as a common set

PurchaseOrderId.description: The (required) PurchaseOrderId Id, in Xfuze canonical form, identifying this purchase order, in the form of PurchaseOrder::[type]_[sourceSystem]_[PurchaseOrderKey] e.g PurchaseOrder::Return_PMC_RET123456789

PurchaseOrderKey.description: The (required) 'natural' purchase order key/number, typically as the system of entry defines (online or retail), and also used to construct the synthetic SO Xfuze Ids. e.g RET123456789

OriginalPurchaseOrderId.description: The PurchaseOrderId Id, in Xfuze canonical form, identifying an 'original' purchase order, in the form of PurchaseOrder::[type]_[sourceSystem]_[OriginalPurchaseOrderKey] e.g PurchaseOrder::Sale_PMC_987654321

OriginalPurchaseOrderKey.description: The original 'natural' purchase order key/number, typically as a way to link related orders together the can be physically separate and need a linking (Return,Exchange etc) e.g 987654321

ParentPurchaseOrderId.description: The PurchaseOrderId Id, in Xfuze canonical form, identifying an 'original' purchase order, in the form of PurchaseOrder::[type]_[sourceSystem]_[OriginalPurchaseOrderKey] e.g PurchaseOrder::Sale_PMC_987654321

ParentPurchaseOrderKey.description: The parent 'natural' purchase order key/number, typically as a way to link to parent orders in an order hierarchy, where one child order has a single parent e.g HireOrder parent order sits above individual hire orders for formal wear hire. NOTE: PurchaseOrderId should contain a parent part if this is the case in its ID construction

ReceiptNumber.description: The customer facing reference number/code, as a customer would see externally, as opposed to an internal key e.g ORD-RET-2044534

OriginalReferenceCode.description: The original 'natural' customer facing reference number/code, typically as a way to link related order together (Return,Exchange) e.g ORD-2044534
